intro: Leptochilus digitatus, commonly known as the digitate lepidote, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in cloud forests. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
